description: Borrowed from Italian gesso. Doublet of gypsum. Compare Spanish yeso (“plaster, cast”).

nouns.description: gesso (usually uncountable, plural gessos or gessoes)

entries.meaning: A mixture of plaster of Paris and glue used to prepare a surface for painting.
examples: The combination of leaf gold and gesso is almost miraculous. No photographic reproduction can adequately show the brilliant effect of raised gesso.

entries.meaning: A work of art done in gesso.
